```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(tidyverse)
library(deSolve)
library(sensitivity)
```

```{r}
## Source in the function
source("./R/dforest_growth.R")


## Parameters

# Given
C_initial = 10 # kg/C
cc_threshold = 50 # kg/C
#K = 250 # kg C
#r = 0.01
#g = 2 # kg/year
#time = 300 years

# Set parameters
time = 300
K = rnorm(mean = 250, sd = 250 * 10, n = time)
r = rnorm(mean = 0.01, sd = 0.01 * 10 , n = time)
g = rnorm(mean = 2, sd = 2 * 10 , n = time)
X1 = cbind.data.frame(r = r, K = K, g = g) # creates a data frame

# Repeat to get our second set of sample parameters (required by sobel function)
time = 300
K = rnorm(mean = 250, sd = 250 * 10, n = time)
r = rnorm(mean = 0.01, sd = 0.01 * 10 , n = time)
g = rnorm(mean = 2, sd = 2 * 10 , n = time)
X2 = cbind.data.frame(r = r, K = K, g = g) # creates a data frame
```

```{r}
## Sobel object

# create sobel object and get both sets of parameters to run the model
sens_C = soboljansen(model = NULL,X1, X2, nboot = 300) 
```
